Creative Cocktail Hour

$10 | $5 for Real Art Ways Members

On the third Thursday of every month, creative people come together for conversation, art, and music.

During the hours of 6-8 PM is the opening reception for Poster Boy: Street Alchemy 2.0. Poster Boy who comments upon the wide array of political issues. Armed with a razor blade, Poster Boy manipulates vinyl advertisements to create startling, harsh or even humorous mash-ups.

Ephemeroom, an exhibition highlighting important moments and objects of Real Art Ways' history, created of relics (memorabilia, photos, ephemera) from our archive and given on loan from our faithful patrons, members and fans.

Also in the galleries is The Making 'of Lamb', an exhibition of drawings by Amy Jean Porter, in collaboration with poet Matthea Harvey. Harvey randomly selected a biography of 19th century British thinker Charles Lamb and began a process of erasure, whiting out words on each page until she had the text of small poems. Porter created drawings of each and sequenced them into a longer work.

From 8-10pm, the American/Brazilian collective Nation Beat entertain us with their fusion sound inspired by Brazilian maracatu drumming, New Orleans second line rhythms, funk and country-blues.

Check out the music....   http://www.nationbeat.com/
